required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Additive Effect of Intravenous Acetaminophen on Postoperative Pain Control
clinical_study.official_title: Additive Effect of Intravenous Acetaminophen Administered at the End of Surgery on Postoperative Pain Control With Nefopam and Fentanyl-based Patient-controlled Analgesia: A Double-blind Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock:
This study aimed to evaluate the additive effect of acetaminophen on postoperative pain control in patients receiving nefopam and fentanyl-based patient-controlled analgesia.
Participants undergoing laparoscopic hysterectomy will be randomly assigned to treatment group or control group. After end of surgery, acetaminophen or normal saline (placebo) will be administered intravenously depending on the group assigned.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Total volume of administered analgesics during postoperative 24 hours
primary_outcome.description: morphine equivalent dose of patient-controlled analgesics administered during first 24 hours after end of surgery

secondary_outcome.description: 11-point numeric rating scale ranging from '0' representing one pain extreme (e.g. "no pain") to '10' representing the other pain extreme (e.g. "pain as bad as you can imagine" or "worst pain imaginable")
11-point numeric rating scale ranging from '0' representing one extreme (e.g. "extremely dissatisfied") to '10' representing the other extreme (e.g. "extremely satisfied")
Incidence of respiratory, gastrointestinal, and central nervous system complications

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of hospital admission until the date of discharge, an average of 1 week

arm_group.description: Patients in this group will receive 1 gram of acetaminophen intravenously after the end of surgery.
Patients in this group will receive 100 ml of normal saline intravenously after the end of surgery.

intervention.description: Acetaminophen will be intravenously administrated to treatment group after the end of surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing total laparoscopic hysterectomy due to uterine myoma, cervical cancer, endometriosis, uterine prolapse
Exclusion Criteria:
- Liver disease (aspartate transaminase OR alanine transaminase > 80 IU/L)
- Chronic kidney disease (GFR < 30 ml/min/1.73m2)
- History of drug allergy
- Chronic pain lasting more than 3 months
- Conversion to laparotomy
- Complex surgery (co-operation with colon surgeon or urologist)
- Limitation in expressing pain
